discourse_list.title: How to improve general public Perception of DAI robustness and enhance the tools of MakerDAO foundation To make new proposals

content.content: ~30% respondents “feel” like it is possible a coordinated action on MKR to perturbate the value of DAI (reddit poll). Even if the mechanism is not identified, this possibility may be a factor to deter some users from using DAI. I think this could be alleviated by explaining better the interplay between MKR, DAI and the rest of the crypto market ecosystem. In practice, there are many scenarios that could be simulated using multi-agent simulations. The result of the many scenarios could be published and peer reviewed to demonstrate that DAI is resilient to certain scenarios and not resilient to other scenarios. This work could also help MakerDAO foundation to make more informed proposals.

So I don’t want to dismiss this out of hand, but Reddit isn’t where I’d go for feedback. Their users are not our target customer and polls there are 100% worthless by virtue of being self selecting. I also don’t really follow what you said after saying there was a Reddit poll where 2-to-1 people apparently said they do trust DAI? I’d still be interested in a link to just see it, though.
reddit   r/MakerDAO - Can Dai stability be perturbed by coordinated action? 0 votes and 6 comments so far on Reddit

The main risk I can see, it is a high spike in the MKR price. I think we are all mentally ready for it.

Dear Risk Core Unit, My question can be rephrased as how are proposals evaluated before becoming a proposal ready for voting. For instance, if a new proposal emerges to change the burning logic, or any other logic involving MKR or DAI, how are the expected short/mid/long term effects of this new logic evaluated. Is this evaluation based on a qualitative analysis by the expert knowledge of the core team members? or maybe are there in place simulation tools able to simulate the effect of the changes under different scenarios? If you have simulation tools, is it possible to know more about this simulation infrastructure? Thank you very much Ildefons
